Package org.shanerx.tradeshop.utils

Class Utils

java.lang.Object
org.shanerx.tradeshop.utils.Utils
Direct Known Subclasses:
JsonConfiguration, ShopChest, ShopSign
public class Utils
extends java.lang.Object
This class contains a bunch of utility methods that are used in almost every class of the plugin. It was designed with the DRY concept in mind.

  • Constructor Summary

    • canExchange

      public boolean canExchange​(org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory inv, org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack itmOut, org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack itmIn)
      Checks whether a trade can take place.
      Parameters:
      inv - the Inventory object representing the inventory that is subject to the transaction.
      itmOut - the ItemStack that is being given away
      itmIn - the ItemStack that is being received
      Returns:
      true if the exchange may take place.

      Returns:
      returns true if valid material

    • containsAtLeast

      public boolean containsAtLeast​(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack[] inv, org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item, int amount)
      Checks whether the an inventory contains at least a certain amount of a certain material inside a specified inventory.
      This works with the ItemStack's durability, which represents how much a tool is broken or, in case of a block, the block data.
      Parameters:
      inv - the Inventory object
      item - the item to be checked
      Returns:
      true if the condition is met.

    • colorize

      public java.lang.String colorize​(java.lang.String msg)
      This function wraps up Bukkit's method ChatColor.translateAlternateColorCodes('&', msg).
      Used for shortening purposes and follows the DRY concept.
      Parameters:
      msg - string containing Color and formatting codes.
      Returns:
      the colorized string returned by the above method.

    • findShopSign

      public org.bukkit.block.Sign findShopSign​(org.bukkit.block.Block chest)
      Finds the TradeShop sign linked to a chest.
      Parameters:
      chest - the block holding the shop's inventory. Can be a chest, a trapped chest, a dropper, a dispenser, a hopper and a shulker box (1.9+).
      Returns:
      the sign.

    • findShopChest

      public org.bukkit.block.Block findShopChest​(org.bukkit.block.Block sign)
      Finds the TradeShop chest, dropper, dispenser, hopper or shulker box (1.9+) linked to a sign.
      Parameters:
      sign - the TradeShop sign
      Returns:
      the shop's inventory holder block.

    • checkShopChest

      public boolean checkShopChest​(org.bukkit.block.Block sign)
      Checks to see if the shop chest is findable
      Parameters:
      sign - the TradeShop sign
      Returns:
      whether the sign is linked to a chest.

      public java.lang.Boolean checkInventory​(org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory inv, java.util.List<org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack> itemList, int multiplier)
      Returns true if inventory has enough cost to make trade
      Parameters:
      inv - inventory to check
      itemList - items to check
      multiplier - multiplier to use for check
      Returns:
      true if shop has enough cost to make trade

    • canExchangeAll

      public boolean canExchangeAll​(org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory inv, java.util.List<org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack> itmOut, java.util.List<org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack> itmIn, int multiplier)
      Checks whether a trade can take place.
      Parameters:
      inv - the Inventory object representing the inventory that is subject to the transaction.
      itmOut - the ItemStack List that is being given away
      itmIn - the ItemStack List that is being received
      multiplier - the multiplier for the trade
      Returns:
      true if the exchange may take place.
